Race.SpecificTitle: Justice of the Peace -- Justice of the Peace District  A
PW School Dist. (Term Limits) -- Local Option - Term Limits
Race.FullText:
"LOCAL OPTION ELECTION
Within Grant Parish School District:
Shall the number of terms of office that any member of the school board may serve be limited to three consecutive four-year terms?"

Race.SpecificTitle: PW School Dist. (Millage) -- 5 Mill - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(School District)
(Renewal Tax)

Summary:  Authority for the Parish School Board of the Parish of Grant to continue to levy a 10-year 5-mill property tax for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating public school buildings in said Parish.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish School Board of the Parish of Grant, State of Louisiana, for school purposes (the "Parish") continue to levy and collect a special tax of five (5.00) mills on all property subject to taxation in said Parish, for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022 (an estimated $183,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating public school buildings in said Parish?

Race.SummaryText:
School District No. 1 Proposition
(Continuation Tax)

Summary:  Authority for School District No. 1 to continue to levy a 10-year 5.20-mill property tax for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating public school buildings in said School District.
Race.FullText: Shall School District No. 1 of the Parish of Grant, Louisiana (the "School District") continue to levy and collect a special tax of five and twenty hundredths (5.20) mills on all property subject to taxation in said School District, for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022 (an estimated $53,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating public school buildings in said School District, said millage to represent a (.18) mill increase over the 5.02 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2012 pursuant to an election held on January 19, 2002?

Race.SpecificTitle: Consolidated School Dist. #11 -- 4.03 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Consolidated School District No. 11 Proposition
(Renewal Tax)

Summary:  Authority for Consolidated School District No. 11 to continue to levy a 10-year 4.03-mill property tax for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating public school buildings in said School District.
Race.FullText: Shall Consolidated School District No. 11 of the Parish of Grant, Louisiana (the "School District") continue to levy and collect a special tax of four and three hundredths (4.03) mills on all property subject to taxation in said School District, for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022 (an estimated $25,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating public school buildings in said School District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Verda School Dist. #31 -- 3.86 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Verda School District No. 31 Proposition
(Renewal Tax)

Summary:  Authority for Verda School District No. 31 to continue to levy a 10-year 3.86-mill property tax for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating public school buildings in said School District.
Race.FullText: Shall Verda School District No. 31 of the Parish of Grant, Louisiana (the "School District") continue to levy and collect a special tax of three and eighty-six hundredths (3.86) mills on all property subject to taxation in said School District, for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022 (an estimated $6,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating public school buildings in said School District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Consolidated School Dist. #33 -- 2 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Consolidated School District No. 33 Proposition
(Continuation Tax)

Summary:  Authority for Consolidated School District No. 33 to continue to levy a 10-year 2-mill property tax for improving, repairing and maintaining South Grant Elementary.
Race.FullText: Shall Consolidated School District No. 33 of the Parish of Grant, Louisiana (the "School District") continue to levy and collect a special tax of two (2) mills on all property subject to taxation in said School District, for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021 (an estimated $60,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for the purpose of improving, repairing and maintaining South Grant Elementary?
